cards.name: Acid Spray Trap
cards.text:
If an enchanted and/or equipped creature is attacking, you may pay {1}{R} rather than pay Acid Spray Trap's mana cost.
Acid Spray Trap deals 5 damage to target attacking creature. Destroy all equipment attached to it.

cards.name: Aerial Grace
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, target creature gains flying and vigilance until end of turn.

cards.flavor: It is the artists' bane to be able to create such wonderful worlds only to be trapped in them, alone.
cards.name: Alone in the World
cards.text: Destroy all creatures, then create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

cards.flavor: Everyone in Delsani has a unique talent to demonstrate.
cards.name: Dashing Swordsman
cards.text:
First strike
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)

cards.flavor: "I don't fight for money. My payment is the beauty of the fight itself."
cards.name: Delsanian Sellsword
cards.text:
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
Whenever Delsanian Sellsword attacks, you may tap target creature.

cards.name: Evanescing Chord
cards.text:
Exile target creature you control. Return that card to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step.
Resonance {2}{W} (If you cast this spell for {2}{W}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.name: Inspiring Ballad
cards.text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
Resonance {3}{W} (If you cast this spell for {3}{W}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.name: Lifesong Flutist
cards.text:
Lifelink
Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Master Stonesculptor
cards.text:
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
When Master Stonesculptor becomes renowned, create a 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature token.

cards.flavor: "Music can reach realms that are otherwise out of our mere human reach."
cards.name: Mystical Minstrel
cards.text: Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

cards.flavor: It only takes one moment of distraction for great minds to get trapped within themselves.
cards.name: Peaceful Thoughts
cards.text: Exile target attacking creature, blocking creature, or enchantment. Its controller gains 4 life.

cards.name: Prismatic Harmony
cards.text:
Target creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
Resonance {1}{W} (If you cast this spell for {1}{W}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.flavor: "Watch your words."
cards.name: Quell Eloquence
cards.text:
Enchant creature you don't control
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, you gain 5 life.

cards.flavor: The librarian district of Seleyn city contains one of the most important book collections of the multiverse.
cards.name: Seleyn Patrollers
cards.text: When Seleyn Patrollers enters the battlefield, target creature gets +1/+1 and gains vigilance until end of turn.

cards.name: Serene Aerosaltant
cards.text:
Flying
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)

cards.flavor: Only the bravest adventurers dare hunt the spiders of Duskwood. Less than half of them return to Delsani with the prized silk.
cards.name: Silkfinder Ranger
cards.text: Protection from Spiders (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by Spiders.)

cards.flavor: Her voice is that of virtue. Her song is that of salvation.
cards.name: Skylyre Archangel
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, permanents you control gain indestructible until your next turn.

cards.flavor: Some artists can reach a state of pure transcendence where they connect with the source of all beauty: the heart of Aenyr itself.
cards.name: Soul Uplift
cards.text: Target creature gains +3/+0 and gains indestructible until end of turn. If it's renowned, untap it.

cards.name: Springveil Dancer
cards.text: Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Springveil Dancer. It gains indestructible until end of turn.

cards.name: Sunblessed Dancer
cards.text:
Flying
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
When Sunblessed Dancer becomes renowned, you may exile all cards from target player's graveyard.

cards.flavor: The Tilkins' songs reflect their peacefulness.
cards.name: Tilkin Flutist
cards.text: Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor:
"Art in itself is neither good nor bad, but those who are ready to do atrocious things in its name need to be punished."
—Foenira the Sage
cards.name: Vengeful Apparitions
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Exile target tapped creature.
• Create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.

cards.flavor: The power of a child's imagination is never to be underestimated. Everything they believe in truly exists, somewhere.
cards.name: Young Dreamer
cards.text: When Young Dreamer enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

cards.flavor: On very rare occasions, Aven flocks perform aerial choirs that leave even the best singers breathless for days.
cards.name: Aven Vocalist
cards.text:
Flying
Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Aven Vocalist.

cards.name: Ballad of Somnolence
cards.text:
Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
Resonance {3}{U} (If you cast this spell for {3}{U}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.flavor:
"Their moves fascinate the soul and body alike. Best not to look."
—Trex, the Sane Jester
cards.name: Captivating Performer
cards.text: {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: Captivating Performer gets +3/+3 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Deep-Sea Dreamhunter
cards.text: Deep-Sea Dreamhunter can't attack unless a card has been put into a graveyard from anywhere this turn.

cards.name: Diminuendo
cards.text:
Creatures target player controls get -3/-0 until end of turn.
Resonance {4}{U} (If you cast this spell for {4}{U}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.flavor:
"Don't fear your dreams, listen to them. There is no greater source of inspiration."
—Roselyn, to Veila
cards.name: Dreamborn Vision
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Draw two cards.
• Create a 2/2 blue Illusion creature token with flying.

cards.flavor: A ghostly sound can soothe very real minds.
cards.name: Ethereal Chord
cards.text:
Scry 3.
Resonance {2}{U} (If you cast this spell for {2}{U}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.flavor:
"What's life without color? Is it still possible to truly find beauty when nothing is left but shades of gray?"
—Foenira the Sage
cards.name: Fade into Nothingness
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library. If that creature is multicolored, put it second from the top instead.

cards.flavor:
"A powerful mind is one that can transcend its own barriers."
—Foenira the Sage
cards.name: Forced Meditation
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may tap target creature an opponent controls and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.flavor: Artistry soars on the wings of the manta.
cards.name: Gliding Mantas
cards.text:
Flying
The first noncreature spell you cast each turn costs {1} less to cast.

cards.flavor:
"I left on the sea to seek inspiration and find beauty. And I found it."
—A Sailor's Journal
cards.name: Graceful Siren
cards.text: When Graceful Siren enters the battlefield, target player draws a card, then discards a card.

cards.flavor:
"How glorious would it be to create the greatest circus anyone has ever known?"
— Olexar Kirsus, The Entertainer's Manifesto
cards.name: Hat Trick
cards.text:
Tap up to three target creatures.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: "For this world's own safety, some stories are better left untold."
cards.name: Keeper of Secret Texts
cards.text: Imaginarium — When Keeper of Secret Texts enters the battlefield, scry X, where X is the number of colors among cards in your graveyard, then draw a card.

cards.flavor: They challenge all your senses at once, leaving you unable to distinguish reality from illusion.
cards.name: Kirsus Hypnotist
cards.text: Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Puppetize
cards.text: Counter target spell. If a creature spell is countered this way, put it onto the battlefield under your control instead of into its owner's graveyard. That permanent becomes a colorless Construct artifact creature with base power and toughness 1/1 and loses all other card types and creature types.

cards.flavor: "... and this is why your argument is completely, unconditionally and undoubtedly invalid."
cards.name: Refute
cards.text: Imaginarium — Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each color among cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: Only they know the secret of the invisible jugglers of the Kirsus Circus.
cards.name: Runesilk Weaver
cards.text: Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, target creature gains hexproof until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Serenade of the Mists
cards.text:
Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
Resonance {2}{U}{U} (If you cast this spell for {2}{U}{U}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.name: The Show Must Go On
cards.text: Imaginarium — Draw cards equal to the number of colors among cards in your graveyard, then discard a card.

cards.flavor: "What is as clear as day, yet you can't see? What is light as a feather, yet can move oceans?"
cards.name: Silent Riddler
cards.text:
Flying
Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: If you find yourself lacking inspiration, it helps to look at the world from a different perspective.
cards.name: Skyseeker
cards.text:
Flying
When Skyseeker enters the battlefield, draw two cards.

cards.name: Symphonic Harmony
cards.text:
Search your library for up to two instants and/or sorcery cards with converted mana cost 3 or less, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
Resonance {5}{U}{U} (If you cast this spell for {5}{U}{U}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.name: Back Alley Crook
cards.text:
Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, each opponent exiles the top card of his or her library.
You may play cards exiled with Back Alley Crook.

cards.name: Ballad of the Lost
cards.text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Resonance {3}{B} (If you cast this spell for {3}{B}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.flavor:
"A mask is meant to conceal its wearer's identity. Sometimes, it also protects everyone else from it."
—Depter, Kirsus actor
cards.name: Beneath the Mask
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player discards two cards.
• Create a 3/3 black Nightmare creature token.

cards.flavor: "Great art can never be created without great suffering."
cards.name: Blood Artist
cards.text: Whenever Blood Artist or another creature dies, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: Some fanatics carve ancient poems into their own skins, believing that it helps birthing those stories into existence.
cards.name: Blood Pact
cards.text: Until end of turn, any time you could cast an instant, you may pay 1 life. If you do, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"This city isn't as safe as it used to be."
—Karina, Delsanian Highborn
cards.name: Brumewing
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Brumewing. You lose 1 life.

cards.name: Chant of the Damned
cards.text:
Each player sacrifices a creature.
Resonance {1}{B}{B} (If you cast this spell for {1}{B}{B}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.flavor: Their song surrounds you, fills your soul and entices you, until it becomes your funeral dirge.
cards.name: Chorus of the Unliving
cards.text:
Menace
Chorus of the Unliving can't block.
Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, you may return Chorus of the Unliving from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Danse Macabre
cards.text: Imaginarium — All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn for each color among cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: When the Kirsus Circus is near, nobody stays rich for long.
cards.name: Dark Profit
cards.text:
Cast Dark Profit only if a creature died this turn.
Draw two cards.

cards.flavor: Each and every member of the Kenoram clan is proud to give his life for a greater cause.
cards.name: Deathcaller Oracle
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Target player loses 1 life. If you sacrificed a Satyr this way, that player loses 2 life instead.

cards.flavor:
"A parasitic idea is to madness what a spark is to fire."
—Ashiok
cards.name: Deepening Dementia
cards.text: Destroy target creature, then choose a player. That player puts a number of cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard equal to that creature's power.

cards.flavor:
"The Kenoram clan gathered tonight as well to perform some strange dances, even though they don't seem to have chosen a victim..."
—An explorer's journal, last entry
cards.name: Deepwood Ritual
cards.text: Create three 1/1 black and green Satyr Bard creature tokens, then sacrifice a creature.

cards.flavor:
"If dreams can be born into the world here, so can nightmares."
—Ashiok
cards.name: Dreameaters
cards.text: When Dreameaters enters the battlefield, you may exile target multicolored card from a graveyard. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Dreameaters.

cards.flavor: His magic flute helps him make sure he receives payment for his art.
cards.name: Duskwood Extortionist
cards.text: Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.flavor:
"Remind me to never again invite a Satyr to play music in my tavern."
—Athela the Innkeeper
cards.name: Kenoram Brawler
cards.text: When Kenoram Brawler enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 black and green Satyr Bard creature token.

cards.name: Kenoram Shadowmancer
cards.text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery and only once each turn.

cards.flavor:
"I go on vacation for a month and this is what happens to the circus. How did it happen? Where is Olexar? I don't understand..."
—Trex, the Sane Jester
cards.name: Kirsus Maniac
cards.text: Discard a card: Kirsus Maniac gains deathtouch until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Take this violin, young Veila, and let your fears out along with its music."
—Roselyn
cards.name: Nightmarish Chord
cards.text:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Resonance {1}{B} (If you cast this spell for {1}{B}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.flavor: Some ideas are destroyed before even being born.
cards.name: Oppressive Nightmares
cards.text: Imaginarium — Destroy target creature with power less than or equal to the number of colors among cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"The eternal beauty of death transcends the ephemeral nature of life."
—Mekar, soulless poet
cards.name: Rotten Pegasus
cards.text:
Flying
Imaginarium — Rotten Pegasus's power is equal to the number of colors among cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: An artless life isn't worth living.
cards.name: Ultimate Price
cards.text: Destroy target monocolored creature.

cards.name: All In
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Discard a card. If you do, draw two cards.
• Discard a card at random. If you do, draw three cards. Choose this mode only if you have two or more cards in hand.

cards.flavor: Fire is the embodiment of passion. So is dance.
cards.name: Ardent Choreography
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Ardent Choreography deals 1 damage to each of up to two target creatures.
• Create a 2/1 red Elemental creature token with haste.

cards.flavor:
"Be careful when you write about fire."
—The Writer's Code, rule #47
cards.name: Blazing Sonnet
cards.text: Blazing Sonnet deals damage to target creature equal to the total number of cards in each player's hand.

cards.name: Deafening Ballad
cards.text:
Up to two target creatures can't block this turn.
Resonance {3}{R} (If you cast this spell for {3]{R}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.name: Disciple of Foenira
cards.text:
{T}: Disciple of Foenira deals 1 damage to target player.
Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, untap Disciple of Foenira.

cards.name: Eminent Painter
cards.text: Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, create two 2/1 red Elemental creature tokens with haste. Exile those tokens at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor:
"Emotions hurt where no armor can protect you."
—Roselyn
cards.name: Fiery Bolero
cards.text:
Fiery Bolero deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Resonance {3}{R} (If you cast this spell for {3}{R}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.flavor: She defines the word "passion" in all its possible meanings.
cards.name: Flamedance Prodigy
cards.text:
Menace
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)

cards.flavor:
"I don't know which is worse, eating raw chicken or a goblin's chicken soup."
—Elania, Food critic
cards.name: Goblin Chef
cards.text:
Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, choose one —
• Another target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
• Target creature can't block this turn.

cards.flavor: Goblins call it "the courage song." Many could argue that "pointless noise" is a more accurate title.
cards.name: Goblin Ukulelist
cards.text:
Haste
Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.

cards.flavor: "Merchants, craftsmen, soldiers, minstrels... they must all sleep at some point. When they do, I'll be waiting for them."
cards.name: High Road Bandit
cards.text: High Road Bandit can't be blocked by creatures with power 1 or less.

cards.flavor: Most artists are either driven or consumed by the passion that burns within. Eregon the painter was both.
cards.name: Inner Flame
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
When enchanted creature dies, Inner Flame deals 2 damage to target player.

cards.flavor:
"How do you like our new pets?"
—Skiv
cards.name: Kirsus Mongrel
cards.text:
First strike, haste
Kirsus Mongrel attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Master Flamedancer
cards.text:
Haste
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
When Master Flamedancer attacks, if it's renowned, exile the top card of your library. Until end of turn, you may play that card.

cards.flavor:
"The Delsanians said my craft wasn't art. I'll show them how my creations can be as magnificent as any of theirs."
—Thelgor the blacksmith
cards.name: Moltenheart Elemental
cards.text: {1}{R}: Moltenheart Elemental gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"One day or another, everyone runs out of ideas."
—Skiv
cards.name: Parch the Mind
cards.text: Parch the Mind deals 2 damage to target player. Tap up to two target lands that player controls. Those lands don't untap during their controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Passionate Anthem
cards.text:
Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. It gains haste until end of turn.
Resonance {3}{R}{R} (If you cast this spell for {3}{R}{R}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.flavor:
"Never forget that your voice is your strongest weapon."
—Ysa, Audiomancer
cards.name: Piercing Shout
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Piercing Shout deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: The few giants left on Aenyr will never forget the times they were tirelessly hunted for glory and great heroic stories.
cards.name: Redrock Mauler
cards.text:
Trample
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)

cards.name: Roselyn Valvidia
cards.text:
+1: Until your next turn, up to one target creature can't block and attacks each turn if able.
-2: Target creature gets +4/-2 and gains haste until end of turn.
-7: You get an emblem with "At the beginning of each combat, gain control of target permanent until end of turn. Untap it. It gains haste until end of turn."

cards.name: Sparkling Chord
cards.text:
Target creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
Resonance {2}{R} (If you cast this spell for {2}{R}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.name: Starsong Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, if it's your turn, untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

cards.name: Torch Juggler
cards.text:
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
As long as Torch Juggler is renowned, it has "{T}: Torch Juggler deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

cards.flavor:
"I don't care how much that damned silk is worth. I'm done.
—Kessen, retired ranger
cards.name: Arachnoid Ambush
cards.text: Create two 1/2 green Spider creature tokens with reach. Then Arachnoid Ambush deals damage equal to the number of Spiders you control to up to one target creature with flying.

cards.flavor: Araknis silk is used by the most skilled tailors to craft the finest clothes on Aenyr. Unfortunately, it can be hard to find anyone willing to go out and gather some.
cards.name: Araknis
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Ashanid the Dreamweaver
cards.text:
Reach
Imaginarium — At the beginning of your upkeep, create a 1/2 green Spider creature token with reach for each color among cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Awakening Melody
cards.text:
Untap target land you control and put five +1/+1 counters on it. It becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.
Resonance {5}{G}{G} (If you cast this spell for {5}{G}{G}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.flavor:
"I think that I shall never see
A poet as long-winded as a tree."
— Selao, Hermit Writer
cards.name: Contemplative Ancient
cards.text: Whenever you gain life, Contemplative Ancient gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: He gets stronger as his music grows louder.
cards.name: Daring Minstrel
cards.text: Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Daring Minstrel.

cards.flavor: There is no such thing as natural or unnatural on Aenyr. There is only what the mind can conceive and what it cannot.
cards.name: Dreamborn Wurm
cards.text: Imaginarium — Dreamborn Wurm costs {1} less to cast for each color among cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: "The woods are infinite and eternal. There are always new paths to be found."
cards.name: Duskwood Neophyte
cards.text: When Duskwood Neophyte enters the battlefield or dies, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature or land card, put it into your hand. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

cards.name: Exalting Fable
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature you control gets +4/+4 and other creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Flourishing Chord
cards.text:
Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
Resonance {2}{G} (If you cast this spell for {2}{G}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.name: Heartening Ballad
cards.text:
Target creature you control gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Resonance {3}{G} (If you cast this spell for {3}{G}, exile it as it resolves. As you cast your next instant or sorcery spell, put this card into your graveyard and you may add its effects and colors to that spell.)

cards.flavor: Members of the Kenoram clan believe that nature is the only thing worth living and dying for.
cards.name: Kenoram Mystic
cards.text: When Kenoram Mystic dies, scry 2.

cards.name: Kenoram Storyteller
cards.text:
Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, put two +1/+1 counters on Kenoram Storyteller.
When Kenoram Storyteller dies, you gain life equal to its power.

cards.flavor: "As you write, your characters slowly become part of who you are. There is a little bit of you in each and everyone of them."
cards.name: Lone Poet
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. When this mana is spent to cast a multicolored spell, you gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: There are no free mastodon in Aenyr anymore. Olexar Kirsus once composed a song powerful enough to tame them, and they are now nothing more than circus beasts.
cards.name: Parade Mastodon
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Parade Mastodon attacks, target creature gains trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The pounding of his drums echo like the heartbeat of the world itself.
cards.name: Primal Drummer
cards.text:
Trample
Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, target creature gets +6/+6 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Even the best stories end someday.
cards.name: Primeval Serenity
cards.text:
Each opponent sacrifices an artifact or an enchantment.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"Drink deep from Aenyr's water and light. It will grow you in ways you couldn't imagine."
—Roselyn, to Veila
cards.name: Prismavore
cards.text: Imaginarium — {2}{G}: Prismavore gets +1/+1 for each color among cards in your graveyard until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "It takes forever to discover the wonders this world has to offer."
cards.name: Satyr Wayfinder
cards.text: When Satyr Wayfinder enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. You may put a land card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Surreal Grandeur
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has reach and trample.
Imaginarium — Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each color among cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"At that moment, Kilvia shivered, for she was alone in the woods no longer."
—Tale of the Lone Hunter, final chapter
cards.name: Tale of the Lone Hunter
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target creature you control fights another target creature.
• Create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.

cards.flavor: His song was so captivating, Veila had no other choice but to follow him deep into the woods.
cards.name: Taunting Satyr
cards.text: Virtuoso — Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, Taunting Satyr gets +1/+1 until end of turn and must be blocked this turn if able.

cards.name: Ashdancer
cards.text:
Your maximum hand size is 0.
You can't draw cards.
At the beginning of your upkeep, exile the top three cards of your library. Until end of turn, you may play those cards.

cards.name: Ashiok, Harbinger of Fear
cards.text:
+1: Target opponent exiles the top card of his or her library, a card from his or her hand, and a card from his or her graveyard.
-2: Exile target creature. Its controller creates a 3/3 black Nightmare creature token.
-9: Until end of turn, you may cast cards exiled with Ashiok without paying their mana costs.

cards.flavor: Poems written with Azurewing feathers are known for the good luck they bring.
cards.name: Azurewing Griffin
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
When Azurewing Griffin enters the battlefield, you may return another target creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: The first painter whose work left its canvas was speechless. He could only utter a single word: "idealon"—perfection.
cards.name: Blazeheart Idealon
cards.text: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"Horror stories are strictly forbidden."
—The Writer's code, rule #3
cards.name: Bookpest
cards.text: Bookpest gets +2/+2 and can't be blocked as long as a graveyard has ten or more cards in it.

cards.flavor: Her voice incites to freedom of thought at any cost, even one's own sanity.
cards.name: Chaosborn Muse
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if that player has no cards in hand, Chaosborn Muse deals 2 damage to each creature you don't control and each opponent.

cards.name: Chimerical Visitant
cards.text:
Flying
When Chimerical Visitant enters the battlefield, if {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} was spent to cast it, you may cast a creature card with converted mana cost 5 or less from your graveyard or hand without paying its mana cost.

cards.flavor: Her voice imbues the greatest painters to create colors they didn't even know could exist.
cards.name: Chromaborn Muse
cards.text: Exile a land card from your hand: Add to your mana pool two mana in any combination of colors that land card could produce.

cards.name: Chromawing Idealon
cards.text:
Flying
When Chromawing Idealon enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Conductor Elemental
cards.text:
Flash
When Conductor Elemental enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, you may reveal an instant or sorcery card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your hand. If you do, copy that card and cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Creativity
cards.text:
Flying
During each turn, you may cast one card you own from outside the game.
If Creativity would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Creativity and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.

cards.flavor:
"There is no better mirror than one made with crystalline feathers."
—Kara, Delsanian highborn
cards.name: Crystalline Falcon
cards.text:
Flying
When Crystalline Falcon deals combat damage to a player, exile up to one target creature you control, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.flavor: "What's the life of one individual worth when it's sacrificed in the name of great artwork?"
cards.name: Delsanian Aristocrat
cards.text:
Lifelink
{1}, Sacrifice a creature: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "The real show starts when screams of excitement turn into shrieks of agony."
cards.name: Destructive Temper
cards.text: Choose a player. Target creature deals damage equal to its power to itself and to that player.

cards.flavor: "This world never rests. Neither shall I."
cards.name: Dreamblade Initiate
cards.text:
Vigilance
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
Dreamblade Initiate attacks each turn if able and blocks each turn if able.

cards.flavor: Some paintings have been born into the world for so long that it's nearly impossible to tell that they once weren't real.
cards.name: Dreamfire Idealon
cards.text: When Dreamfire Idealon enters the battlefield, you may have it fight target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.name: Dreams from Beyond
cards.text: Imaginarium — You may cast target instant, sorcery or creature card from an opponent's graveyard without paying its mana cost if its converted mana cost is less than or equal to the number of colors among cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: "Lets do it again. And again."
cards.name: Duplication
cards.text: Create a token that's a copy of target permanent card in your graveyard, then return that card to your hand.

cards.flavor: Her voice speaks of Life, and Death, and the infinite cycle in between.
cards.name: Duskborn Muse
cards.text:
The first creature spell you cast each turn costs {1} less to cast for each creature card in your graveyard.
{1}{B}{G}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Every tree in the Duskwood forest contains the soul of a Kenoram satyr waiting to be brought back to life by its brethren.
cards.name: Duskwood Soulguide
cards.text:
Other Satyr creatures you control get +1/+1.
{2}{B}{G}: Return target Satyr card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Her voice reverberates through eternity, as do the songs she performs.
cards.name: Echoborn Muse
cards.text:
Flying
If a triggered ability of a permanent you control would trigger, that ability triggers twice instead.

cards.flavor: There is no dance more perfect than one that never ends.
cards.name: Eidolic Waltz
cards.text: Exile up to one target creature you control and up to one target creature you don't control, then return those cards to the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor: The Glamor District is home to one magnificent museum for each senate-approved art form. It's a shame only the wealthiest can enter.
cards.name: Entry Fee
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Eraser of Thoughts
cards.text:
Flying
When Eraser of Thoughts dies, exile all nonland cards from target player's graveyard. For each card exiled this way, search that player's hand and library for all cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Eregon's Masterpiece
cards.text:
Eregon's Masterpiece can't be blocked by more than one creature.
Whenever Eregon's Masterpiece attacks, search your library for a creature card and exile it. Then, for each creature card exiled with Eregon's Masterpiece, create a tapped and attacking token that's a copy of that card. Exile them at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: When you see perfection, you never forget what it looks like.
cards.name: Exquisite Idealon
cards.text:
Flash
Flying, lifelink
When Exquisite Idealon enters the battlefield, if you've been dealt damage this turn, draw a card.

cards.flavor: "How do people manage to live one single life with one single face?"
cards.name: Facestealer
cards.text: You may have Facestealer enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield or creature card in a graveyard.

cards.name: Fantasia Wyrm
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Fantasia Wyrm gets +1/+0 until end of turn, then scry 1.

cards.flavor: When circus animals are fierce enough to run away from their former jailers, their courage inspire songs for decades to come.
cards.name: Fearless Feline
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Fearless Feline enters the battlefield with an amount of +1/+1 counters on it equal to the amount of life you've gained this turn.

cards.name: Flawless Performance
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has vigilance, lifelink, and "{T}: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player."
When enchanted creature dies, return Flawless Performance to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Gloom Tender
cards.text:
Imaginarium — {T}: For each color among cards in your graveyard, add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
{2}{B}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Gloom Tender: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Her voice ebbs and flows, like the dancers she invigorates.
cards.name: Graceborn Muse
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, you may exile another target nonland permanent. If you do, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor:
"We all belong to the same world and, in the end, we all share the same fate. It's a privilege that you will encounter yours sooner."
—Lyss of Duskwood
cards.name: Grasp of Nature
cards.text: Destroy target creature. Search your library for a Forest card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: As Kirsus performers distract the audience, hazewalkers roam the crowd in search of rich pockets to pick.
cards.name: Hazewalker
cards.text:
Flash
Lifelink
If an opponent would gain life, you gain that much life instead.

cards.flavor:
"How could someone put so much hatred in a painting?"
—Telia, painter apprentice
cards.name: Hellish Idealon
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Whenever Hellish Idealon dealt combat damage to a player, discard a card.

cards.flavor: Her voice speaks of wealth, nobility, and a twisted representation of equity.
cards.name: Highborn Muse
cards.text: Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, create a colorless artifact token named Gold. It has "Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Illusory Projections
cards.text: For each creature card in a graveyard, create a token that's a copy of that creature except it's an Illusion in addition to its other types and it has "When this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it."

cards.flavor:
"A song isn't written with ink and paper. It's written with emotions."
—Roselyn
cards.name: Improvised Composition
cards.text: Scry 4, then draw two cards, then discard two cards, then exile the top two cards of your library. Until end of turn, you may play cards exiled this way.

cards.name: Infernal Cacophony
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, exile target card from a graveyard. If you exiled a creature card this way, create a 3/3 black Nightmare creature token. If you exiled a noncreature card this way, Infernal Cacophony deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: "The stories I can't write with my pen, I write with my sword."
cards.name: Intrepid Poet
cards.text:
Renown 2 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put two +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes renowned.)
Whenever a creature you control becomes renowned, Intrepid Poet deals 2 damage to target player and you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: "The cycle of life and death is the most simple representation of Nature's omnipotence."
cards.name: Kenoram Warlock
cards.text: Whenever another creature you control dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Kenoram Warlock.

cards.flavor: Works of photomancy are perfectly accurate, for they contain the life of the subject itself.
cards.name: Lifelike Canvas
cards.text: When Lifelike Canvas enters the battlefield, exile target nonland permanent an opponent controls until Lifelike Canvas leaves the battlefield. (That permanent returns under its owner's control.)

cards.name: Lost in Eternity
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one. If you would draw a card during that turn, draw two cards instead. If you would gain life during that turn, you gain twice that much life instead. If you tap a land for mana during that turn, it produces twice as much of that mana instead. Exile Lost in Eternity.

cards.name: Lyss, Duskwood Seer
cards.text:
Whenever you sacrifice Lyss or another Satyr creature, you may draw a card.
{T}, Pay X life, Sacrifice a creature: Search your library for a Satyr card with converted mana cost X, reveal it and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: "My next trick is so absolutely amazing, you won't believe your eyes."
cards.name: Mad Jester
cards.text: When Mad Jester enters the battlefield, each player discards a card.

cards.name: Majestic Runehart
cards.text:
Vigilance, protection from converted mana cost 3 or less
{5}{G}{W}, Exile Majestic Runehart from your graveyard: Target creature gets +4/+4, gains vigilance and gains protection from converted mana cost 3 or less until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Her voice is never twice the same, for no artist can ever be truly complacent.
cards.name: Maskborn Muse
cards.text: Whenever one or more cards an opponent owns are put into that player's graveyard for the first time each turn, draw a card.

cards.name: Masquerade Infiltrator
cards.text:
{R}, Sacrifice Masquerade Infiltrator: Masquerade Infiltrator deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
{B}, Sacrifice Masquerade Infiltrator: Target opponent discards two cards. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.name: Masterly Maneuver
cards.text: Choose target creature or player. Until end of turn, if a source would deal damage to an attacking creature you control, it deals that much damage to the chosen target instead.

cards.name: Mental Transgression
cards.text: Search target player's library for up to one nonland card and exile it. Repeat this process for that player's hand and graveyard. Then that player shuffles his or her library. For as long as those cards remain in exile, you may cast them and spend mana as though it were mana of any color to do so.

cards.flavor: "Where does inspiration come from?" asked Veila. "From the most beautiful things in this world," replied Foenira.
cards.name: Mistwalker Idealon
cards.text: Trample, lifelink

cards.name: Moment of Quietude
cards.text:
Moment of Quietude can't be countered.
Until end of turn, permanents you control gain indestructible and hexproof, you can't lose life, and spells or abilities your opponents control can't cause you to discard cards.

cards.name: Never Forgotten
cards.text:
You have no maximum hand size.
If a creature card you own would die, return that card to your hand instead.

cards.name: Persona Elemental
cards.text:
When Persona Elemental enters the battlefield, target player draws a card.
When Persona Elemental leaves the battlefield, target player discards a card.

cards.flavor: "It's not enough to make everybody else believe that you experience those emotions. They have to feel them as much as you are."
cards.name: Persona Shift
cards.text: Exchange two target creatures' base power until end of turn.

cards.flavor: He carries the strength of a whole clan to battle.
cards.name: Possessed Brute
cards.text:
Trample
Sacrifice a creature: Possessed Brute gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If you sacrificed a Satyr this way, Possessed Brute gets +3/+3 until end of turn instead.

cards.flavor: "You call that abstract post-realism?"
cards.name: Pretentious Critic
cards.text:
When Pretentious Critic enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Search your library for a multicolored card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
• Put target multicolored permanent on the bottom of its owner's library.

cards.flavor: There is no better predator, as a single one can become a whole pack within seconds.
cards.name: Prism-Maned Idealon
cards.text:
Menace
Whenever Prism-Maned Idealon deas combat damage to a player, create a token that's a copy of it.

cards.name: Psychic Laceration
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Its controller loses 3 life.

cards.flavor: Many still explore the dangerous Redrock cliffs, hoping to one day find glory and be the heroes of their own epic stories.
cards.name: Redrock Hydra
cards.text:
Redrock Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
When Redrock Hydra enters the battlefield, it deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Serana had trouble writing about her character's aggressiveness until she encountered a giant in Redrock cliffs.
cards.name: Resentful Giant
cards.text: When Resentful Giant enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land. Resentful Giant deals damage equal to that permanent's converted mana cost to that permanent's controller.

cards.flavor:
"Where life grows, death follows."
—Lyss, Duskwood Seer
cards.name: Seed of Despair
cards.text:
Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn.
Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.

cards.name: Senate of Censures
cards.text:
Vigilance
When Senate of Censures enters the battlefield, create a colorless artifact token named Decree with "As this token enters the battlefield, name a card" and "Sacrifice this artifact: Counter target spell with the chosen name."

cards.name: Shifting Seasons
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
• Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Skiv, Madcap Trickster
cards.text:
When Skiv, Madcap Trickster enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card at random.
Whenever an opponent discards a creature card, you may put that card onto the battlefield under your control. If you do, that creature gains haste. Sacrifice it at the beginning of your next end step.

cards.name: Skyguard Challenger
cards.text:
Flying, double strike
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)

cards.flavor: In a world where creativity is the key to power, some people's thoughts can turn out to be their worst enemies.
cards.name: Soul Fracture
cards.text: Target opponent loses 2 life. Create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.

cards.name: Sound Blast
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target noncreature spell unless its controller pays {3}.
• Sound Blast deals 3 damage to target creature.

cards.flavor: The Springveil festival is the most expected event of Aenyr, reassembling thousands of artists wanting to prove their worth to the whole world.
cards.name: Springveil Celebation
cards.text:
At the beginning of each end step, if you've gained life this turn, draw a card.
{4}{G/W}{G/W}: You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Sunfire Choreography
cards.text: Sunfire Choreography deals 2 damage to target creature or player. Add two mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool.

cards.name: Thought Storm
cards.text:
Until end of turn, whenever you draw a card, Thought Storm deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: "There is nothing to combat that my music can't evoke twice as strong."
cards.name: Thundersong Trumpeter
cards.text: {T}: Target creature can't attack or block this turn.

cards.flavor: When Veila's spark ignited, she planeswalked to Aenyr and arrived in a Tilkin village. They sheltered her, healed her and protected her until she was ready to explore the world.
cards.name: Tilkin Sentry
cards.text:
Vigilance
Whenever an opponent casts a spell during your turn, Tilkin Sentry gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Eregon frantically painted his every feeling. When he finished, the painting came to life in an outburst of unnatural energy, devastating the town... and Roselyn's heart.
cards.name: Torrent of Emotions
cards.text: Torrent of Emotions deals damage to each creature equal to the number of instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard. Then shuffle your graveyard into your library.

cards.flavor: Her voice is like a dream, both surreal and sublime.
cards.name: Tranceborn Muse
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token. If it's a land card, add two mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool at the beginning of your next main phase. If it's a noncreature, nonland card, draw a card.

cards.flavor: It's not the end, just a new beginning.
cards.name: Turn to Aether
cards.text: Put two target nonland permanents with the same controller on top of their owner's library in any order.

cards.name: Veila Lokan
cards.text:
+1: Up to one target creature gets +1/+1 until your next turn. You gain 1 life.
-X: You may put a creature card with converted mana cost X from your hand onto the battlefield.
-6: For each creature you control, search your library for a card with the same name as that creature and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Her voice is as captivating as the stories she inspires.
cards.name: Verseborn Muse
cards.text:
Creatures you control have lifelink.
Whenever you gain life, put a +1/+1 counter on Verseborn Muse.

cards.flavor:
"Accomplishing sinister things taints one's soul forever. Doing so in the name of beauty makes no difference whatsoever."
—Foenira the Sage
cards.name: Wandering Soul
cards.text: When Wandering Soul dies, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

cards.flavor: Her voice is like a blade, sharp yet elegant.
cards.name: Warborn Muse
cards.text: Your opponents can't attack or block with more than one creature each combat.

cards.flavor: "I didn't realize the word "no" could inspire so many great works of art."
cards.name: Words of Denial
cards.text: Counter target spell. Spells your opponents cast this turn cost {1} more to cast.

cards.name: Worldgorger Idealon
cards.text:
Flying, trample
Whenever Worldgorger Idealon attacks, you may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}. If you do, exile target nonland permanent and put three +1/+1 counters on Worldgorger Idealon.

cards.name: Aurora Ritual
cards.text: Imaginarium — Exile the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of colors among cards in your graveyard. You may put any number of creature and/or land cards from among those cards onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"What's the difference between sword fighting and dancing? Your life."
—Elyza the Duelist
cards.name: Bladewhirl
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains double strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Sometimes, the line between perfectionism and relentless ambition can be very thin.
cards.name: Boon of the Twin Roses
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2 and has lifelink.

cards.flavor: They forbid the entrance to anyone who doesn't look insane enough.
cards.name: Carnival Sentinel
cards.text: Whenever a player discards one or more cards, Carnival Sentinel deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Dancing Master
cards.text:
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
Whenever Dancing Master is dealt damage, if it's renowned, it deals that much damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Dream Harvest
cards.text: Choose target creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player or planeswalker this turn, draw that many cards.

cards.name: Duskwood Shaman
cards.text:
Whenever another creature dies, if it's the first time a creature died this turn, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Duskwood Shaman.
• Scry 2.
• You gain 3 life.

cards.flavor: Never trust a Kirsus psychic.
cards.name: Fortune Telling
cards.text: Each player draws two cards, then discards a card at random.

cards.flavor: Nobody has been able to determine whether it was a celebration of Life or Death.
cards.name: Grim Revel
cards.text: Imaginarium — Create a 1/1 black and green Satyr Bard creature token for each color among cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Impromptu Performance
cards.text:
The next multicolored card you cast this turn can be cast as though it had flash.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Luck of the Draw
cards.text:
When Luck of the Draw enters the battlefield, name three nonland cards.
Whenever you draw a card, reveal it. If a named card is revealed this way, put a luck counter on Luck of the Draw. Then, if Luck of the Draw has five or more luck counters on it, you win the game.

cards.flavor: It's the first and last thing you hear when Skiv is near.
cards.name: Madcap Laughter
cards.text:
Creatures you control get +2/+0 and gain haste until end of turn.
You may cast Madcap Laughter from your graveyard by discarding a card in addition to paying its other costs.

cards.flavor:
"Anything you imagine can take form here."
—Foenira, to Veila
cards.name: Manifestation of Vitality
cards.text: When Manifestation of Vitality enters the battlefield or attacks, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Membrane of Souls
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
When Membrane of Souls enters the battlefield, create three 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.

cards.name: Mental Trauma
cards.text: Target player puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If two or more cards put into a graveyard this way share a color, return Mental Trauma to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: "I dare you to catch me before I catch you."
cards.name: Mocking Jester

cards.flavor:
"Even if you like bright colors, it's sometimes in your best interests to stay as far away from them as possible."
—Painter's saying
cards.name: Oglosaur

cards.flavor: Its voice echo through the auditorium for days after the play is over.
cards.name: Opera Ghost

cards.flavor: The greatest musicians never truly die. They roam in the afterlife for eternity and regroup in symphonies whose songs are indescribable by the living.
cards.name: Phantasmal Triad

cards.flavor: In a world where everything seems so beautiful, people tend to quickly forget about the notion of danger.
cards.name: Poisonous Advantage
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains deathtouch until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Some artists choose to have art engraved on their own skin, becoming themselves eternal nexuses of the beauty they worship.
cards.name: Radiant Skinmarks
cards.text: At the beginning of your precombat main phase, add {R}{G} to your mana pool. If that mana is spent on a creature spell, it gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "I see failure in your future... unless you can afford to pay me right now."
cards.name: Renegade Fortuneteller
cards.text:
Each opponent plays with the top card of his or her library revealed.
You may play the top card of your opponents' libraries.

cards.flavor: You might try to follow one of her choreographies as closely as possible, but she will always be two steps ahead and behind you, at all times.
cards.name: Ribbon Whirler

cards.flavor: A poet's worst enemy is his own lack of insight.
cards.name: Search for Inspiration
cards.text: Choose a color, then reveal the top five cards of your library. You may put up to two cards of the chosen color revealed this way into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: "So many stories to read, yet so little time to do so."
cards.name: Seleyn Librarian
cards.text: If a player would search a library, that player draws a card instead.

cards.flavor: The bihorns of Eversun meadows inspired countless over the years. While the poets and painters merely observed, hoping to capture nature's majesty in their art, the more pragmatic sought their hide and ivory for quality leather and fine jewelry.
cards.name: Solitary Bihorn

cards.flavor: His sword cuts through ideas and flesh as if they were the same.
cards.name: Spellslicer Duelist
cards.text: When Spellslicer Duelist enters the battlefield, noncreature spells target opponent casts cost {2} more to cast until your next turn.

cards.flavor: A good story is one that could end well, shockingly or even sadly. An amazing story, however, is one that lasts forever.
cards.name: Storytime
cards.text:
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
{1}{G}{W}, Sacrifice Storytime: Search your library for a creature card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Voice of Lost Songs
cards.text:
When Voice of Lost Songs enters the battlefield, return target card with resonance from your graveyard to your hand.
Each spell you cast for its resonance cost costs {1} less to cast.

cards.name: Wistful Sonnet
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Return target creature card with converted mana cost X or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
• Return up to X target creature cards with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Chromatic Brush
cards.text:
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
{T}: Choose one or more colors. The next spell you cast this turn is the chosen color or colors in addition to its other colors.

cards.flavor: Delsani's marble guardians are made by the most talented sculptors of Aenyr, enchanted so that they are immune to all forms of art.
cards.name: Delsanian Sentinel
cards.text: Imaginarium — For each color among cards in your graveyard, Delsanian Sentinel has protection from that color.

cards.name: Elegant Blade
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0, has first strike, and has “Whenever this creature attacks, you may pay {R}{W}. If you do, target creature defending player controls untaps and blocks it this turn if able.”
Equip {2}

cards.flavor:
"I can't play with it, but I can still use it to smash your skull."
—Tog, Goblin scout
cards.name: Ensorcelled Instrument

cards.flavor: The first to pick up the light before a play could be considered lucky—if there weren't as many contenders.
cards.name: Ghostlight
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Exile target card from a graveyard. Create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

cards.flavor: Even the most talented sculptors can lose control of their work in a matter of seconds.
cards.name: Hulking Creation

cards.flavor: An abandoned circus isn't any safer than an occupied one.
cards.name: Jest-In-The-Box
cards.text: When Jest-In-The-Box enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Painter's Servant
cards.text:
As Painter's Servant enters the battlefield, choose a color.
All cards that aren't on the battlefield, spells, and permanents are the chosen color in addition to their other colors.

cards.flavor: They are used only by the greatest architects: those who wish to alter the land itself.
cards.name: Scapeforger Bauble
cards.text:
When Scapeforger Bauble enters the battlefield, draw a card.
{T}: Target land you control becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "The music is in the drum. I simply coax it out to be heard."
cards.name: Springleaf Drum
cards.text: {T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"Some plays are far more impressive when they're not seen in plain light. The mystery they're shrouded in tickles the imagination."
—Jellan, theatrical assistant
cards.name: Strobe Light
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Strobe Light: Exile target creature you control, then return it to the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor:
"Within a book lie endless possibilities that only you can master."
—The Writer's Code, introduction
cards.name: Tome of Infinity
cards.text: You may choose any number of additional modes on spells and abilities you control. You can't choose the same mode more than once this way. (Modes are generally indicated after "Choose one.")

cards.name: Cloudy Jungle
cards.text:
When Cloudy Jungle enters the battlefield, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.
{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: What started as a mere painting now flourishes within Aenyr's landscape.
cards.name: Dreamborn Paradise
cards.text:
Dreamborn Paradise enters the battlefield tapped.
As Dreamborn Paradise enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Enlightened Valley
cards.text:
When Enlightened Valley enters the battlefield, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Ethereal Gardens
cards.text:
When Ethereal Gardens enters the battlefield, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Even though the tower was destroyed ages ago, winds blowing nearby still echo the songs that once resonated within its walls.
cards.name: Ghostly Tower
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Ghostly Tower: Return target multicolored card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Gloomy Marshlands
cards.text:
When Gloomy Marshlands enters the battlefield, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Heart of Creativity
cards.text:
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
Whenever you tap Heart of Creativity for mana, each opponent may scry 1.

cards.name: Lifespring River
cards.text:
When Lifespring River enters the battlefield, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mistfire Ridge
cards.text:
When Mistfire Ridge enters the battlefield, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.
{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Its first eruption created the colors of the world.
cards.name: Mount Chromaziel
cards.text:
{T}, Reveal a land card from your hand: Add to your mana pool one mana of any type that the revealed land could produce.
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}, {T}: Search your library for a multicolored card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Scorched Landscape
cards.text:
When Scorched Landscape enters the battlefield, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Sunlit Wasteland
cards.text:
When Sunlit Wasteland enters the battlefield, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.
{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Tranquil Ridge
cards.text:
When Tranquil Ridge enters the battlefield, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.
{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Twisted Landscape
cards.text:
When Twisted Landscape enters the battlefield, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: He never makes the same patrol twice, so each day is a different experience from the last.
cards.name: Aven Harrier
cards.text:
Flying
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Blessed Aspirant
cards.text:
Dreamwalk (This creature can’t be blocked by untapped creatures. Tapped creatures can block it.)
Whenever Blessed Aspirant becomes tapped, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Champion of Altor
cards.text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, you may tap target creature.

cards.flavor:
“Each day I strive to return Noctus to the peace it once knew.”
—Evis, Executor of Light
cards.name: Cleansing Stroke
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.flavor:
“Ral’s manipulation of the Dreamscape is madness. He must be stopped before he brings disaster to us all.”
—Evis, Executor of Light
cards.name: Daumas Paladin
cards.text: Whenever Daumas Paladin attacks, if defending player controls a tapped creature, Daumas Paladin gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Daumas Patrol
cards.text:
Create two 2/2 white Knight creature tokens with vigilance.
Premonition 4—{1}{W} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{W} and put this card into your library face up just beneath the top four cards. As it reaches the top, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor:
“Our subconscious is a battlefield now. A front on which our enemies can attack us.”
—Evis, Executor of Light
cards.name: Dawn Crusader
cards.text: Dreamwalk (This creature can’t be blocked by untapped creatures. Tapped creatures can block it.)

cards.flavor: Nature's potential no longer has limits.
cards.name: Abundant Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
When Abundant Growth enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted land has "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.flavor: In another life, maybe you made eye contact, said hello. Maybe you could've been friends.
cards.name: A Face in the Crowd
cards.text:
Exile target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
Dreamcycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card into exile with a dreaming counter on it: Draw a card.)

cards.flavor: "I'm assembling a posse to slay Malastrix. Who's with me?"
cards.name: Ace Holden
cards.text: {W}{W}: Prevent all noncombat damage that would be dealt to creatures you control this turn.
